report.finding:
A 64 Y/O male; Clinical Information:

  s/p TUR-P and biopsy 102-10-15 , iPSA:?, GS:4+4 , DRE:cT2c RT >> LT , now on 

  antiandrogen casodex 3# QD, ‧其他, 無此高風險記錄‧其他, 無此高風險記錄

  

  MRI study for the pelvic cavity, mainly for the prostate gland and seminal 

  vesicles with screening of the abdomen without and with IV contrast injection 

  shows: 

  

  1. Widening of the prostate urethra probably due to previous TUR-P procedure.

  2. Low signal intensed nodular lesions at the right peripheral zones without 

  singal change after intravenous Gd-DTPA administration suggesting postoperative 

  scar formation. Residual and recurrent tumor is less likely.

  3. Unremarkable of bilateral seminal vesicles.

  4. Left renal cysts.  The visible liver, spleen, pancreas, right kidney and 

  adrenal glands are unremarkable.

  5. No significant LAP in the PA region, pelvic cavity and inguinal region.

  6. No bony pathology of visible bony structures.

  

    IMP:

  Prostate malignancy S/P TUR-P with scar formation. No obvious residual and 

  recurrent tumor was shown.

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 2.5 hours after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP (i.v.).

    

    The whole body bone scan revealed multiple focal area(s) of increased uptake of 

    radioactivity involving the T10 spine, T12 spine, sacrum (score 3), T6-8 spines,

     bilateral ischiums (score 2), upper left C-spine, L5 spine, bilateral shoulder 

    joints, left knee joint and left distal tibia (score 1).

    

    As compared with previous bone scan on 2013/10/17, the previous T and sacral 

    spine lesions were less evident, the T12 spine and T6-8 spine lesions were more 

    evident, and the other lesions were relatively stationary.





Impression:

    1. High probability of bony metastasis at T10 spine, T12 spine, and sacrum.

    2. T6-8 spine and bilateral ischial lesions, bony metastases cannot be excluded.

    3. Upper C spine and L5 spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    4. Multiple joint lesions, probably arthritis.

    5. Left distal tibial lesion, probably post-traumatic response.





Suggesstion:

    Nil





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Socre 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy





            判讀醫師　　：曾敬仁

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 3hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP (i.v.).

         The whole body bone scan revealed multiple focal areas of increased uptake 

    of radioactivity involving the T10 and T12 spines, sacrum (score 3), mid C-spine

    , T6-T8 and L5 spines (score 1), right acromion, and left knee joint (score 1). 

          

         As compared with previous study on 2014-2-25, these lesions seemed 

    stationary.





Impression:

    1. Stationary T-spine and sacrum lesions, malignancy metastases cannot be 

    excluded completely.

    2. Other spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    2. Right acromion and left knee joint lesion, probably arthritis.





Suggesstion:

    Clinical follow up.





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Socre 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy





            判讀醫師　　：蘇子佩

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 3hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP (i.v.).

         The whole body bone scan revealed multiple focal areas of increased uptake 

    of radioactivity involving the T10 and T12 spines, sacrum (score 2), mid C-spine

    , T6-T8 and L4-L5 spines, bilateral shoulders, left knee joint (score 1), 

    bilateral ischium (score 2) .

         As compared with previous study on 2014-5-22, these lesions seemed 

    stationary.





Impression:

    1. Stationary T10, T12, and sacrum lesions, malignancy metastases cannot be 

    excluded completely.

    2. Other spine lesions, degenerative spine disease was more likely.

    3. Mild bilateral ischium lesions, either post-traumatic response or malignancy 

    metastases may show this picture.

    4. Multiple joint lesions, probably arthritis.





Suggestion:

    Clinical follow-up.





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Socre 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 3 hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP (i.v.) and 

    revealed multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the

     thoracolumbar spine, sacrum, bilateral ischium, left knee joint and right 

    acromioclavicular joint (score 1).

         There was no other focal area of abnormal uptake of radioactivity involving

     the whole skeletal system.

         As compared with previous bone scan on 2014/11/12, the old lesions became 

    less evident.





Impression:

    1. No definite evidence of malignancy bony metastasis.

    2. Spine and sacrum lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    3. Left knee joint and right acromioclavicular joint, probably arthritis.

    4. Bilateral ischium, probably benign in nature.





Suggestion:

    Nil





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Socre 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy





            判讀醫師　　：蘇永約

A 68 Y/O male; right femoral hematoma r/o dissection or aneurysm



1. Subcutaneous edema/hematoma at right inguinal region.

2. Atherosclerotic calcifications at aortoiliac and femoral arteries.

3. Mild stenosis of right common and external iliac arteries.

4. No evidence of pseudoaneurysm formation.

5. Only faint enhancement of right lower leg arteries distal to the popliteal 

artery, suspect due to relative slow flow rather than occlusion. Suggest 

clinical correlation.

6. Otherwise no evidence of severe stenosis or occlusion of the other portion of

 bilateral arteries.

7. S/P Foley catheter. 



IMP: 

1. Subcutaneous edema/hematoma at right inguinal region.

2. Mild stenosis of right common and external iliac arteries.

3. No evidence of pseudoaneurysm formation or contrast extravasation.

4. Only faint enhancement of right lower leg arteries distal to the popliteal 

artery, suspect due to relative slow flow rather than occlusion. Suggest 

clinical correlation.

Report:

    The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study was performed with dipyridamole 

    pharmacologic stress. Intravenous dipyridamole was administered at a rate of 0.1

    42 mg/kg/min for 4 min. The administered dose was 10.45 ml (5mg/ml).

         No significant discomfort was noted during dipyridamole stress.

         The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion  SPECT study performed 5 mins after 

    intravenous injection of 2mCi of Tl-201 and 4 hours later revealed reduced 

    uptake of radioactivity in inferior segments of LV in stress study.

         There was parital redistribution in these segments in delayed study. 

         The EKG-gated functional study showed: Stress LVEF=63%, Rest LVEF=59%.





Impression:

    Mixed myocardial infarction with trivial ischemia at inferior segments of LV.





Suggestion:

    Nil





            判讀醫師　　：林煥鈞

Clinical Information: 69 Y/O male, referred for prostate cancer, s/p TUR-P and 

biopsy 102-10-15, iPSA:16 GS:4+4 DRE:cT2c RT >> LT , now on antiandrogen casodex

 3# QD, urooncology conference cT3aN0M1b, LHRH start 102-12, supply Ca and vit D

, bone scan 104-05 T10 lesion decreased , s/p bone scan for elevated PSA 106-01 

, s/p cardiac stest *3  106-07, closely f/u PSA 106-11 107-01,  mCRPC 107-04 , 

staging bone scan ABD CT.



TECHNIQUE: CT of abdomen and pelvis without and with IV contrast enhancement.

 

COMPARISON: None.

 

FINDINGS:

1. Abdomen and pelvis: 

   - Small prostate gland C/W post hormone therapy change.

   - Fatty liver.

   - Collapse of gallbladder.

   - Left renal cysts.

2. Lymph nodes: 

   - Small paraaortic lymph nodes.

3. Lung base: Unremarkable.

4. Cardiovascular system: 

   - Aneurysmal dilatation of infrarenal aorta (2.8 cm, se5 im43) and bil. 

common iliac arteries. Atherosclerosis with vascular calcification.

5. Bones: 

   - Degenerative change of spine.

   - Sclerotic bone lesion at T10 vertebral body, C/W bone metastases.

6. Others: None.

 

IMPRESSION:

1. C/W prostate cancer with bone metastases S/P hormone therapy. Stationary 

sclerotic bone metastases at T10. Otherwise, no evidence of metastasis.

2. Small aortoiliac aneurysm (2.8 cm at infrarenal aorta, se5 im43).

CLINICAL INFORMATION: 70 Y/O male; mCRPC on enzalutamide.



TECHNIQUE: CT of whole body without and with IV contrast enhancement.



COMPARISON: 2018/11/6 CT. 2018/5/22 CT.

 

FINDINGS:

1. Lower neck: Unremarkable.

2. Chest: Unremarkable.

3. Abdomen and pelvis:

   - Small prostate gland C/W post hormone therapy change.

   - Few pancreatic duct stones with mild dilatation of P-duct.

   - A tiny right renal calyceal stone. Bilateral renal cysts.

   - Diverticula of cecum and A-colon.

4. Lymph nodes:

   - Borderline sized subcarina lymph node (se5 im42), stationary, possible 

reactive change.

5. Cardiovascular system: 

   - Aneurysmal dilatation of infrarenal aorta (3 cm in diameter) and bil. 

common iliac arteries. Atherosclerosis with vascular calcification.

6. Musculoskeletal system: 

   - Degenerative change of spine.

   - T10 bone metastases with regression of sclerotic change.

7. Others: None.

 

IMPRESSION: 

1. Prostate cancer with bone metastases S/P hormone therapy. T10 bone metastases

 with regression of sclerotic change. No evidence of new metastases.

2. Small aortoiliac aneurysm (3 cm in diameter at infrarenal aorta).

3. Few pancreatic duct stones with mild dilatation of P-duct.

4. A tiny right renal calyceal stone.

Report:

    The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study was performed with dipyridamole 

    pharmacologic stress. Intravenous dipyridamole was administered at a rate of 0.1

    42 mg/kg/min for 4 min. The administered dose was 10.28 ml (5mg/ml).

         The patient experienced headache during the stress test, and the symptom 

    was relieved by intravenous injection of 75mg aminophylline.

         The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study performed 5 mins after 

    intravenous injection of 2 mCi of Tl-201 and 4 hours later revealed reduced 

    uptake of radioactivity in inferior segment of LV in stress study.

         There was parital redistribution in that segment in delayed study. 

         The EKG-gated functional study showed: Stress LVEF=58%, Rest LVEF=65%. 

    





Impression:

    Mixed myocardial ischemia and infarction at inferior segment of LV.

    





            判讀醫師　　：何宗穎

CLINICAL INFORMATION: 70 Y/O male; mCRPC on enzalutamide.



TECHNIQUE: CT of whole body without and with IV contrast enhancement.

COMPARISON: 2018/11/6 CT. 2018/5/22 CT. 2019/12/24

 

[Main Findings]

1. Small prostate gland C/W post hormone therapy change.

2. New non-ehanced cystic lesion at pancreatic tail (1.2 cm, Se5Im67). D/D: 

simple cyst, cystadenoma, IPMN.



[Other Findings]

1. Few pancreatic duct stones with mild dilatation of P-duct.

2. Tiny right renal calyceal stone. Bilateral renal cysts.

3. Diverticula of cecum and A-colon.

4. No prominent nodes in retroperitoneum, pelvis and bilateral iliac chains.

5. Stationary aneurysmal dilatation of infrarenal aorta (3 cm in diameter) and 

bil. common iliac arteries. Atherosclerosis with vascular calcification.

6. T10 bone metastases with regression of sclerotic change.

7. Centrilobular emphysema in bilateral lungs.

 

IMPRESSION: 

1. Prostate cancer with bone metastases S/P hormone therapy. No evidence of new 

metastases.

2. Stationary aortoiliac aneurysm.

3. New non-ehanced cystic lesion at pancreatic tail (1.2 cm). D/D: simple cyst, 

cystadenoma, IPMN. Pancreatic duct stones with upstream P-duct dilatation.

Report:

    ** PROCEDURE

    The bone scan was requested for oncology survey. The bone scan was performed 3 

    hr after given 20 mCi Tc-99m MDP(i.v.). Previous scan on 2019-12-20 was 

    available for comparison.  

    ** SCAN FINDINGS

    -  Multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the T10 

    spine (score 2), T7/T8, L2-L3 spine, bilateral shoulder and bilateral knee 

    joints (score 1)

    -  As compared with previous study the scan showed disease regression.

    





Impression:

    * Mild T10 spine lesion, favoring post-therapy effect.

    T7/T8 and L2-L3 spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    Bilateral shoulder and knee joint arthritis.

    





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign; Score 2 = equivocal; Score 3 = possible 

    malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

A 71 Y/O male;

Clinical Information:

Pancreatic tumor



EXAMINATION TECHNIQUE: 

Multiplanar multisequence MRI study of the upper abdomen without and with Gd-

DTPA dynamic enhancement as well as MRCP obtained with multislice technique and 

single-shot thick slab technique were performed.

 

COMPARISON:

CT dated 2020.12.6 



FINDINGS: 

Compared with CT, this study shows tiny P-duct stones with upstream P-duct 

beaded dilation and loss of T1-hyperintensity signal of pancreatic tail. A small

 lesion (15 mm) with cyst features is noted at pancreatic tail. 

It shows no abnormal enhancement or water restriction.

Several cortical cysts are note at bil kidneys.

Degenerative joint and disk disease of L-spine 

Fatty marrow replacement and canal stenosis at L4/5

The liver, spleen, adrenals are unremarkable.



IMPRESSION: 

Tiny P-duct stones with chronic pancreatitis at tail region

Small pseudocyst or branch duct dilation at pancreatic tail

Report:

    The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study was performed with dipyridamole 

    pharmacologic stress. Intravenous dipyridamole was administered at a rate of 0.1

    42 mg/kg/min for 4 min. The administered dose was 10.0 ml (5mg/ml).

         No significant discomfort was noted during dipyridamole stress.

         The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion  SPECT study performed 5 mins after 

    intravenous injection of Tl-201 and 4 hours later revealed reduced uptake of 

    radioactivity in inferior, basal septal segments of LV in stress study.

         There were parital redistribution in inferior segment; and no 

    redistribution in basal septal segment; in delayed study. 

         The EKG-gated functional study showed: Stress LVEF=61%, Rest LVEF=62%. 

         Stress defect: 39% of total myocardium

         Reversibility: 53% of total (LAD: 67%, LCX: 36%, RCA: 50%).

    





Impression:

    - Mixed myocardial ischemia and infarction at inferior segment of LV.

    - Myocardial infarction at basal septal segment of LV.

    





Memo:

    Preparation by 許超英 | Draft by 張思瀚

    





            判讀醫師　　：張思瀚

This 73 Y/O male patient was a case of prostate cancer with bony metastases S/P 

treatment for follow-up.



CT scan from lower neck to pelvis without and with IV administration of contrast

medium shows:



1. Lower neck:

   -Grossly stationary small right SCF LN.

2. Chest: 

   -Small bullaes in all lobes of both lungs.

   -Stationary bilateral mediastinal reactive nodes.

3. Abdomen and pelvis: 

   -Small prostate gland C/W post hormone therapy change.

   -Stationary pancreatic tail cyst, DDx: cyst, branch duct IPMN.

   -Right renal stone. Bilateral renal cysts.

   -Chronic cystitis.

   -Diverticulosis of colon.

4. Musculoskeletal system: 

   -T10 bone metastasis with regression of sclerotic change.

   -Degenerative change of thoracolumbar spine with spur formation.

5. Vessels: 

   -Atherosclerosis of aorta and major branches and coronary arteries.

   -Aortic aneurysms at DsAo (max 42.6 mm/od), abdominal aorta renal level (max 

32.0 mm/od) and infrarenal level (max 31.5 mm/od).



IMP:

Prostate cancer with bone metastases S/P hormone therapy. T10 bone metastasis 

with regression of sclerotic change. No evidence of new metastasis.

Aortic aneurysms at DsAo (max 42.6 mm/od), abdominal aorta renal level (max 32.0

mm/od) and infrarenal level (max 31.5 mm/od).

Report:

    The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study was performed with dipyridamole 

    pharmacologic stress. Intravenous dipyridamole was administered at a rate of 0.1

    42 mg/kg/min for 4 min. The administered dose was 9.6 ml (5mg/ml).

         The patient experienced headache/dizziness during the stress test, and the 

    symptom was relieved by aminophylline.

         The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion  SPECT study performed 5 mins after 

    intravenous injection of Tl-201 and 4 hours later revealed reduced uptake of 

    radioactivity in apex, inferolateral, apical anterior segment(s) of LV in stress

     study.

         There were redistribution in apex, apical anterior segment(s); and parital 

    redistribution in inferolateral segment(s); in delayed study. 

         The EKG-gated functional study showed: Stress LVEF=52%, Rest LVEF=55%. 

         Stress defect: 38% of total myocardium

         Reversibility: 86% of total (LAD: 97%, LCX: 18%, RCA: 25%).

    





Impression:

    - Myocardial ischemia at apex, apical anterior segments of LV.

    - Mixed myocardial ischemia and infarction at inferolateral segments of LV.

    





Memo:

    Preparation by 許超英 | Draft by 張思瀚

    





            判讀醫師　　：張思瀚

正子掃瞄:

    【 Indication 】: 

    Esophageal cancer, for systemic survey. 

    Tongue cancer s/p op.

    ˉ

    【 Procedure 】:

    The patient was injected intravenously with 5 mCi of F-18-fluorodeoxyglucose(FDG

    ) after fasting.Blood glucose level was 136 mg/dl at the time of injection. Non-

    contrast-enhanced CT scan was initially and followed by PET scan obtained from 

    the top of the skull to the proximal thighs. Dual time imaging was employed.

    CT imaging was performed for attenuation correction and anatomic localization 

    only.

    ˉ

    【 Content 】:

    1. There is a segmental area (about 4.0cm in long) of increased FDG uptake in 

    upper third thoracic esophagus (SUVmax: 9.8).

    2. A segmental area of moderately increased uptake in lower esophagus (SUVmax: 5

    .4).

    3. Focal areas of moderately increased uptake in right lower paratracheal LNs (

    SUVmax: 5.8), AP window LNs (SUVmax: 4.6), and middle thoracic paraesophgeal LN 

    (SUVmax: 3.7).

    4. A focal area of mildly increased uptake in the patchy cosolidation over left 

    lower lung (SUVmax: 1.3), may due to inflammation.

    5. Physiological FDG uptake and accumulation in the brain, tonsils, salivary 

    glands, heart, liver, spleen, GI tracts, GU tracts.

    ˉ

    【 Impression 】:

    1. Compatible with upper third thoracic esophageal cancer.

    2. Moderate FDG-avid lesions in mediastinal LNs, LNs involvement cannot be 

    excluded.

    3. FDG-avidity in lower esophagus, reflux esophagitis or tumor. Suggest clinical

     correlation.

正子掃瞄:

    【 Indication 】:

    The 65-year-old man is a case of cervical upper third esophageal cancer, 

    cT3N1, stage IIIA, s/p CCRT. 06/10 CEA: < 0.5 ng/mL, SCC: 0.70 ng/mL. 

    09/15 CT: Disease (esophageal cancer) regression.

    FDG-PET/CT study was arranged for treatment response evaluation.

    ˉ

    【 Procedure 】:

    Fasting >4 hrs; blood sugar: 136 mg/dl

    Radiotracer: FDG 193 MBq (IV) followed by rest for 1hr

    Scan protocol: low dose CT (C-) and PET (3D TOF) from head to toe

    Optional delayed (3hr) image: yes

    ˉ

    【 Content 】:

    1. There was a segmental area of increased FDG uptake in the upper third

       esophagus (SUVmax:3.0, delayed SUVmax:3.58). 

    2. There were increased FDG uptake in the right lower paratracheal 

       (SUVmax:3.8, delayed SUVmax:5.8), AP window (SUVmax:2.8, delayed 

       SUVmax:3.7), para-aortic (SUVmax:3.2, delayed SUVmax:3.0) regions.

       As compared with previous FDG-PET study of 2020/09/15, the lesions

       were in regressive change.

    3. There was a focal area of increased FDG uptake in the left pleura 

       (SUVmax:3.6, delayed SUVmax:4.7).

    4. There was a focal area of increased FDG uptake in left abdominal wall

       (SUVmax:3.4), compatible with jejunostomy.

    5. Physiological FDG uptake and accumulation in the brain, tonsils, 

       salivary glands, heart, liver, spleen, GI tracts, GU tracts.

    6. No definite abnormal FDG uptake can be demonstrated elsewhere.

    ˉ

    【 Impression 】:

    1. FDG-avid lesion in upper third esophagus, post-treatment response may

       show this picture.

    2. FDG-avid lesions in mediastinal LNs, reactive LNs is suspected. However,

       residual viable tumor cannot be totally excluded.

    3. Suspect post-irradiation response in left pleura.

       Suggest correlated with chest CT.

Indications: Esophageal cancer s/p treatment for follow-up

骨骼:

    [History]: Newly diagnosed prostatic cancer, for staging

    

    [Procedure]: The whole body bone scan was performed at 3 hrs after 

    intravenous injection 21.5 mCi of the Tc-99m MDP. 

    

    [Findings]:

    1. Focal areas of moderately increased radioactivity in the left 

    middle cervical spine, L2/3, medial aspect of right knee, both 

    ankles, and left 1st metatarsophalangeal joint (all score 1).

    2. A cold area in the left knee indicates prosthesis implantation.

    3. No significant abnormality can be demonstrated elsewhere.

      

    [Impression]: 

    1. No definite evidence of bone metastasis.

    2. Active C- and L-spine lesion, degenerative change is likely.

    3. Active above mentioned joint lesions, probably osteoarthritis.

    4. S/P left knee arthroplasty.

      

    [Comment]:

    score 0: normal; score 1: possibly benign; score 2: equivocal lesion;

    score 3: possibly malignancy; score 4: high probability of malignancy

    revealed multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the

     C-spine, L-spine, right knee and bilateral ankle and feet joints (score 1).

     the whole skeletal system.

    2. Spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    3. Multiple joints lesions, probably arthritis.

    4. Status post left knee arthroplasty.





Suggestion:

    Nil

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Score 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

Clinical Information: A 86 Y/O male is a case of prostate cancer, S/P TURP and 

HIFU.



Abdomen and pelvis MRI were obtained with axial T1WI, T2WI, sagittal T2WI, 

coronal T2WI and fat.-sat. images of axial & coronal scans without and with Gd-

DTPA enhancement and abdominal T2WI MRI were performed as ordered by clinicians 

for a patient of prostate cancer, S/P TURP, now with PSA = 0.13.  

Comparison: 2017-03-02 CT of pelvis



It shows: 

1. S/P TURP. Enhancing nodule, 2.0 cm, anterior to TURP at anterior prostate 

gland noted. D.D.: BPH nodule, prostate cancer, combination of the above two 

conditions.

2. No prominent nodes in retroperitoneum, pelvis and bilateral iliac chains. 

3. No remarkable findings in liver, pancreas, spleen, gallbladder, biliary trees

, bilateral kidneys, and adrenal glands. 

4. No active lung lesion in the bilateral basal lungs. 

5. No definite bony metastasis in the scanned field of this MRI study. 

Degeneration of the T-L spine with marginal spurs formation. 



IMP: Prostate cancer, S/P radical prostatectomy. Enhancing nodule at anterior 

prostate with the above listed differential diagnosis. Suggest biopsy for 

histological proof.

    of radioactivity involving the right frontal sinus, right maxillary area of the 

    head, right 5-7th codtochondral juncvtions, right upper portion of right S-I 

    joint, and metatrsal area of right foot.

         There was also a focal area of increased radioagent uptake at right 

    anterior lower neck, thyroid nodule should be watched out in location.

         As compared with previous study on 2014-9-16, the skull, and costochondral 

    lesions were new, while the right anterior lower neck lesion was less obvious.

    

    [Impression]

    2. Active right frontal and maxillary lesions, probably sinusitis may cause this

     picture.

    4. Mild right S-I joint lesion, probably sacroiliiits.

    5. Right foot lesion, probably mild arthritis.

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 2hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP

     (i.v.).

         The whole body bone scan revealed three focal areas of increased 

    uptake of radioactivity involving the left 6th rib at anterolateral 

    aspect(score 2), L5 spine and left knee joint(score 1).

         There was no other focal area of abnormal uptake of radioactivity

     in the whole body skeletal system.





Impression:

    1. Left rib lesion, post-traumatic response was more likely.

    2. L5 spine lesion, probably degenerative spine disease.

    3. Left knee joint lesion, probably arthritis.





Suggesstion:

    Nil





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion; Score 2 = equivocal lesion;

     Score 3 = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of 

    malignancy.

  extra-capsular extension, no neurovascular bundle invasion, no seminal vesicle 

  invasion, no pelvic sidewall invasion, and no pelvic organ(s) (rectum, bladder) 

  invasion.

  

  Regional nodal metastasis:

  There is no regional nodal metastasis at obturator (right, left, bilateral), 

  internal iliac (right, left, bilateral), external iliac (right, left, bilateral), 

  and sacral areas.

  Other findings: diffuse hemorrhage of prostate gland and seminal vesicles as well 

  as left posterior periprostate area.

  

  IMP: prostate cancer, T2CN0.

A 69 Y/O male is a patient of biopsy-proven prostate cancer (Gleason score: 4 + 

5 = 9, PSA 342). MRI of prostate for staging.



MRI study for the pelvic cavity with screening of the abdomen and 

retroperitoneum, mainly for the prostate without and with IV contrast study 

shows: 



**Comparison to MRI study: nil



[Main findings]

1. A mass lesion (3.6 cm in the largest dimension) with T2 hypointensity mainly 

involving apical and mid portions of left prostate. The lesion has relatively 

low contrast enhancement on post-Gd images. Water restriction of the lesion is 

noted one DWI/ADC. This mass lesion is consistent with prostate cnacer.

2. Extra-prostaic extension at left aspect of the prostate (Se16;Im10). The 

tumor also invades left seminal vesicle (Se16;Im5).

3. Bony metastasis to L-spine and sacrum, presenting as ovoid areas with 

contrast enhancement and water restriction (Se24;Im72 and Se24;Im110).

4. An equivocal lymph node (1 cm) at left lower paraaortic area (Se24;Im75, 

score 2).

5. No definite metastasis in the abdominal solid organs including liver, 

pancreas, spleen, bilateral kidneys and adrenal glands.



[Other findings] 

1. Two hepatic lesions (up to 1.8 cm) with marked T2 hyperintensity and avid 

contrast enhancment in medial and lateral segments of the liver respectively, in

 favor of hepatic hemangiomas (score 2).

2. Renal cysts in the bilaeral kidneys.



IMP: Prstate cancer with extra-prostatic extension, seminal vesicle invasion and

 bony metastasis. MRI staging: T3bN0M1b.

Stage I

vesicles.

Brief hx: prostate cancer for staging
s/p biopsy, bladder urothelial tumor 

MRI of the pelvis and prostate with and without enhancement

Techniques:

AXL T1WI and T2WI including C+/C-, SAG T1WI/C=, T2/FSE, DWI and ADC pulse

 sequences

Findings:

Enlargement of central portion due to glandular hypertrophy change s/p TURP

Narrowed peripheral zones of prostate 

Multiple bil. prostate lesions over both peripheral and central zones with low 

SI on T2WI, increased intensity on DWI and decreased on ADC, compatible with 

prostate cancer

Intact left prostatic capsule and periprostatic fat plane but partial 

obliteration over right side may be tumor invasion

Focal abnormal T2 hypointense change of central seminal vesciles may be due to 

tumor invasion

No enlarged lymph node in the pelvis 

No evident bony destruction

Focal urinary bladder wall thickening over bil. bases r/o focal recurrent tumor

IMP: 

Prostate cancer of bil. lobes with tumor invasion to seminal vesicles

Report:

    [Procedure]

    The renal scinitgraphy study (26050B) with dynamic function evaluation (26020B) 

    was performed following intravenous injection of 10 mCi Tc-99m DTPA, posteiror 

    dynamic angiogram and sequential static images of the kidneys were obtained. 20 

    mg furosemide (i.v.) was given 30 minutes into the study.

    [Findings]

    1. Renal scintigraphy: 

      poor perfusion of radioactivity to the left kidney.

      progressive accumulation of radioactivity in the pelvic regoin of left kidney.

      persistent accumulation of radioactivity in the pelvic region of left kidney 

    after lasix.

    2. Quantification function assay:

      The count ratio of left kidney to total at 2-3 minutes after DTPA injeciton 

    was 3.64 %.

      The radioactive urine clearance half-time (T1/2) from the pelvic region of 

    left kidney (according to the fitting curve after furosemide injection) couldn't

     be calculated.





Impression:

    1. The count ratio of left kidney to total at 2-3 minutes after DTPA injeciton 

    was 3.64 %.

    2. The degree of hydronephrosis of the left kidney could not be evaluated due to

     impaired function and poor uptake.





Suggestion:

    Nil





Comment:

    Nil

Report:

    ** INDICATION

    A case of prostate cancer and bladder UC s/p operation, for follow-up.

    ** PROCEDURE for FDG

    Before whole body survey, the patient was required to fast for at least 4 hours.

     Blood sugar level was measured 189 mg/dl. Then, 10.01 mCi of 18F-FDG was 

    injected intravenously. The patient was put into the scanner in the "arm-up" 

    position, and the scan from vertex to upper thighs was performed at 70 min. 

    There was no immediately complication during the procedure. The scan was 

    adequate for interpretation.

    

    ** SCAN FINDINGS

    The level and distribution of radioactivity:

    1. Main tumor status:

      Not found (score 0)

    2. Regional LN status:

      Not found (score 0)

    3. Distant site status:

      Subpleural nodule in the right upper lung without measurable FDG uptake (score

     2)

    





Impression:

    1. Prostate and urinary bladder cancer post treatment without definite 

    locoregional recurrrence.

    2. Right upper lung lesion, granuloma may show this picture. Please follow up 

    with chest CT.

    





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion; Score 2 = equivocal lesion; Score 3 =

     possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy.

    (Pre-injection: 10.01 mCi @ 11:57 | Post-injection: 0mCi @ 11:57)

    Body height: 159 cm; Body weight: 85.9 Kg.

A 80 Y/O male, bladder cancer S/P cystoprostatectomy and ileal conduit 

reconstruction.



TECHNIQUE: MR of pelvis without and with IV contrast enhancement

COMPARISON: MR on 2021/08/03 and 2020/08/12



It shows: 

1. S/P cystoprosatectomy and ileal conduit formation. No definite local tumor 

recurrence.

2. presistent left hydronephrosis with paper thin of left renal parenchyma and 

obvious left hydroureter with obstruction at left uretero-ileal conduit 

anastomotic site noted. At the obstruction site, no obvious enhancing tumor, and

no diffusion restriction foci are noted. Thus, long-term chronic stenosis at 

left uretero-anastomotic site is considered. 

3. patent right urotract without hydronephrosis; a few right renal cysts.

4. No definite lymphadenopathy at pelvis and bilateral inguinal regions.

5. No definite bony metastasis in the scanned filed of this MR.



Impression: 

Prostate and urinary bladder cancer S/P cystoprosatectomy and ileal conduit 

formation. No definitie radiological evidence of local recurrence on this MR 

study. Chronic stenosis at left uretero-ileal conduit anastomotic site with 

resultant obvious left hydronephrosis with paper thin of left renal parenchyma 

and obvious left hydroureter.

  3. Retrolisthesis of L3/4, L4/5, L5/S1, grade I.

  4. Bulging discs at T12/L1 (mild), L1/2 (mild to moderate, larger at left 

  foraminal-lateral aspect), L2/3 (severe), L3/4 (sandwiched disc), L4/5 (moderate

  ), L5/S1 (sandwiched disc) with thecal sac compression and bilateral foraminal

   L-S endplates.

  8. Diffuse marrow replacement of the visible skeleton, suspect osteoporosis.

  9. No obvious paraspinal mass. Bilateral renal cysts. Right lobe hepatic cyst.  

  

  IMP:

   foraminal effacement due to scoliosis, bulging discs, facet hypertrophy, 

  retrolisthesis, and marginal osteophytes, more severe at L2/3, L3/4, L4/5 levels

  .

  2. Diffuse marrow replacement of the visible skeleton, r/o osteoporosis.

Report:

    The dopamine transporter brain image was performed 4 hours after given 25mCi of 

    Tc-99m TRODAT (i.v.). The Tc-99m TRODAT-1 was obtained in a 1-vial kit 

    formulation from the INER. The final sterilized product was produced by 

    autoclaving the mixture for 30 min.

    1. The SPECT image set showed little background noise, and the quality is 

    adequate for interpretation. Moderate dilated ventricle was noted.

    2. There was mild decreased uptake of radioactivity involving the bilateral 

    striatum. The images showed uniform loss of radioactivity in the striatum.

    3. There was predominant loss of dopaminergic radioactivity over left striatum.

    4. The visual scores of right and left caudate were 2 and 3. Those of the right 

    and left putamen were 3 and 4.





Impression:

    1. Left side predominant asymmetric presynaptic dopaminergic lesion (score 2/3/3

    /4), Parkinsonism with presynaptic dopaminergic lesion or vascular lesions at 

    basal ganglion may show this picture.

    2. Ventricle dilation was noted.

Brief hx: a 67 y/o male with prostate cancer (adenocarcinoma), PSA level= 6.08 (

20191224) and MRI for tumor staging.



MRI of the pelvis and prostate with and without enhancement:



Techniques:

T1WI AXL, T1WI/FS/C+ (AXL COR), T2WI (AXL COR SAG), T2WI/FS AXL, DWI/ADC AXL. 



Findings:

Diffuse enlargement of transitional zones due to glandular hypertrophy change. 

Hyperintensity in right lobe prostate gland at T1WI without obvious enhancement,

 favor post-biopsy change (hemorrhage).  

 

Uneven low intense areas in right peripheral and transition zones at T2WI and 

ADC map, bright SI at DWI,favor prostate cancer(s). 

 

No definite extracapsule extention. 

No obvious tumoral direct invasion of bil. seminal vesicles. 

Patency of the fat plane between prostate-rectum and interface of prostate and 

urinary bladder.  

Wall thickened of urinary bladder with pseudodiverticula formation. 

No definite enlarged pelvic and retroperitoneal lymph nodes. 

No definite fluid collection in pelvic cavity.  

No definite enhanced bony lesion. 

 

IMP:  

* Prostate cancers in right peripheral and transition zones.

* Post-biopsy change (hemorrhage) of prostate.

A 66 Y/O male; Clinical Information: DOE, Dyspnea, R/O lung fibrosis

  

  High resolution CT of the both lungs without and with IV contrast medium 

  enhancement was performed. 

  

  Technique: 1 mm slice thickness and 10 mm intervals. No tilting of gantry. Display 

  window =1400, level = -500. Matrix size: 512 x 512. KVp = 120, MA = 140, scan time:

   2 sec. 

  Recontruction parameter = bone algorythm.

  

  1. Presence of intralobular interstitial thickening and honeycombing appearance of 

  both lungs prominently in BLL. Bronchiectasis over BLL was noted. The findings are 

  suggestive of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

  2. No obvious gross soft tissue nodule or mass in both lungs.

  3. No obvious enlarged lymph node in mediastinum and bilateral hilar regions.

  4. Liver cysts and bilateral renal cysts.

  

    IMP:

  In favor of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

A 68 Y/O male with history of bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia

  

  HRCT of lung and routine chest CT without IV contrast enhancement shows:

  

  1. Mild lung fibrosis in BLLs, RML and peripheral zone of BULs. Regressive 

  change as compared with previous CT on 2012-6-6.

  2. Mild bronchiectasis in the BLLs and RML.

  3. Centrilobular emphysema in BULs.

  4. No pleural effusion or pleural nodule.

  5. No enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum.

  6. Several liver cysts and renal cysts, stationary.

  7. No ascites in the visible upper abdomen.

  8. No definite bony destruction in the scannd field.

  

  Impression: 

  1. Mild lung fibrosis in BLLs, RML and peripheral zone of BULs. Regressive 

  change as compared with previous CT on 2012-6-6.

  2. Bronchiectasis and emphysema as described.

Magnetic Resonance Imaging of Pelvis With and Without Enhancement Show:



<<Significant Finding>>

1. Enlargement with hetergenous enhancement of prostate gland

2. Ill defined abnormal low signal in the bil.transition zone of prostate on T2

WI, r/o BPH change

3. Crescent shape low signal in the left bladder base transition zone of 

prostate on T2WI(se:6 img:13), r/o maligancy (PI-RADS:3)

4. No evidence of tumor extracapsular extension posteriorly or the seminal 

vesicle be invaded

5. The rectovesical facia and perirectal fat is relatively clear

6. Thickened & irregularity of urinary bladder wall compatible with chronic

 cystitis

7. The rectal sphinter, pelvic side wall and levator ani muscle is not invaded

8. There are no enlarged regional LNs

9. No evident signal alteration of pelvic bone to reveal metastasis









Impression:

1. Ill defined abnormal low signal in the bil.transition zone of prostate on T2

WI, r/o BPH change

2. Crescent shape low signal in the left bladder base transition zone of 

prostate on T2WI(se:6 img:13), r/o maligancy (PI-RADS:3)

3. There are no enlarged regional LNs

骨骼:

    [History]: prostate cancer, for staging; Gleason: 3+4, iPSA: 15.79

    

    [Findings]:

    The Tc-99m MDP whole body bone study at 3hrs after I.V. injection of

    21.7mCi of the agent revealed focal areas of increased radioactivity 

    in the right T9/T10, L4/5 and L5/S1 spinal junctions, right acromion, 

    and bilateral knees at medial aspect. 

    There was no other abnormal focal area of increased uptake of radio-

    activity in the whole body skeletal system.

      

    [Impression]:

    1. Probably negative study for bone metastasis.

    2. T9/T10, L4/5 and L5/S1 lesions, more likely degenerative change. 

    3. Right acromion and bilateral knee lesions, probably osteoarthritis. 

     

    [Suggestion]: 

    Follow up bone scan.

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 2.5 hr after given 20 mCi Tc-99m MDP(i.v). Finding 

    of whole body scan,  as followed:

    -  multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the T10-L

    1 spines (score 4), bilateral ribs (score 3), mid C- and T8 spines (score 2).

    





Impression:

    1. Multiple active bone lesions, compatible with malignancy bony metastases.

    2. Bilateral rib lesions, either bony metastases or post-traumatic response may 

    be considered.

    3. Mid C- and T8 spine lesions, degenerative spine disease is likely.

    





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign; Score 2 = equivocal; Score 3 = possible 

    malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

    The bone scan was requested for oncology survey. The bone scan was performed 2.5

     hr after given 20 mCi Tc-99m MDP(i.v.). Previous scan on 2021/1/22 was 

    available for comparison.  

    ** SCAN FINDINGS

    - focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the T-L spines and 

    bilateral ribs (score 3).

    - As compared with previous study the scan showed disease regression.

    





Impression:

    Multiple bone lesions, probably malignancy bony metastases in response to 

    treatment.

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign; Score 2 = equivocal; Score 3 = possible 

    malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

A 71 Y/O male;

  Clinical Information: LBP for years, both legs radition.

  

  TECHNIQUE: Multiplanar, multisequence MRI of the Lumbar Spine without 

  contrast enhancement

  

  COMPARISON: No relevant comparison studies available from PACS

  

  FINDINGS:

  1. Heterogenous signal intensity in the visualized vertebrae. DDx: 

  fatty degeneration, infiltrative marrow disease. Suggest clinical 

  correlation.

  2. Compressive fracture of L3 without significant thecal sac 

  compression.

  3. The curvature of lumbar spine is less lordotic than normal.

  4. Unremarkable facets and ligamentum flavum.

  5. No definite abnormal signal intensity in the visualized spinal cord.

  

  

  IMPRESSION:

  1. Heterogenous signal intensity in the visualized vertebrae. DDx: 

  fatty degeneration, infiltrative marrow disease. Suggest clinical 

  correlation.

  2. No significant spinal canal or neuroforaminal stenosis.

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 3hrs after given 15 mCi of Tc-99m MDP

    (i.v.).     The whole body bone scan revealed three focal areas of

    increased uptake of radioactivity involving the left shoulder joint

    region, and L3-4 spines.

    





Impression:

    1. L3-4 spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.2. Left

    shoulder joint lesion, probably arthritis.3. Thoracis scoliosis was

    noted.

    





Suggesstion:

    Nil

    





Comment:

    Nil

Report:

    The stress testing was performed with intravenous dipyridamole injection at a 

    rate of 0.142 mg/kg/min for 4 min.

         No significant discomfort was noted during stress.

         The myocardial perfusion SPECT was perforemd at 5 minutes after intravenous

     injection of 3 mCi Tl-201 and 4 hours later.

         It revealed homogeneous distribution of radioactivity in myocardium of left

     ventricle in both stress and rest studies.

    





Impression:

    No evidence of myocardial infarction or ischemia.

    





Suggesstion:

    Please correlate with clinical and other cardiac examination findings.

80 Y/O male with dypnea and bil. lung nodules.



CT of chest with and without contrast enhancement shows:



1. Multiple randomized nodules in bil. lungs. Cavitation in some of the nodules,

 highly suspicious metastases. DDx: TB or septic emboli, less likely.

2. A 3.3-cm spiculated lesion in LLL (Se900b Im33, Se8 Im26), suspicious primary

 lung cancer.

3. Mildly enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum, highly suspicious metastases.

4. No pleural effusion.

5. Bil. renal stones. No hydronephrosis. Collapsed gallbladder.

6. No remarkable finding of liver, spleen, pancreas, bil. adrenal glands.

7. No bowel loop dilatation. No ascites in the visible upper abdomen.

8. Post vertebroplasty of L3. No definite bony destruction in the scannd field.



Impression: 

1. Multiple randomized nodules in bil. lungs. Cavitation in some of the nodules,

 highly suspicious metastases. DDx: TB or septic emboli, less likely.

2. A 3.3-cm spiculated lesion in LLL (Se900b Im33, Se8 Im26), suspicious primary

 lung cancer.

3. Suspicious metastatic nodes in the mediastinum.

Report:

    The whole body bone scan was performed at 3 hrs after intravenous injection of 2

    0 mCi Tc-99m MDP and revealed multiple focal areas of increased radioactivity 

    uptake involving right 5-7 and left 5th ribs (score 1), L3-4 spines (score 1).

         There was no other abnormal focus of increased radioactivity uptake in the 

    whole skeletal system.





Impression:

    1. No definite evidence of malignancy bony metastasis.

    2. L-spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    3. Bilateral rib lesions, probably post-traumatic responses.





Suggesstion:

    Please correlate with other image findings and more follow-up bone scans for 

    comparison.





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion; Score 2 = equivocal lesion; Score 3 =

     possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy.

骨骼:

    【 Clinical 】: Prostate cancer

    

    ˉ

    【 Impression 】:

    Probably negative for bone metastasis.

Brief hx: prostate cancer for staging
s/p biopsy 

MRI of the pelvis and prostate with and without enhancement

Techniques:

AXL T1WI and T2WI including C+/C-, SAG T1WI/C=, T2/FSE, DWI and ADC pulse

 sequences

Findings:

Diffuse enlargement of central portion due to central glandular hypertrophy

 change

Narrowed peripheral zones of prostate 

Multiple uneven areas of higher signal intensity on T1WI and lower on T2WI over 

bil. peripheral zones, more favor post-biopsy effect

Multiple bil. prostate lesions over both peripheral and central zones with low 

SI on T2WI, increased intensity on DWI and decreased on ADC, compatible with 

prostate cancer

Obliterated bil. prostatic capsule and periprostatic fat planes due to tumor

 invasion

Hypointense lesions on T2WI of bil. seminal vesciles due to tumor invasion

No enlarged lymph node in the pelvis 

No evident bony destruction

IMP: 

Prostate cancer of bil. lobes with right focal extracapsular invasion

Brief Hx: a 62-year-old male patient with prostate cancer for further evaluation.

  No previous CT study was availble to compare.

  Abdomen and pelvis CT without and with IV enhancement studies

  Techniques: 

    From lower chest to pubic edge in 5-mm contiguous section for before and after 

  IV enhancement CT.

    

  Findings:

  Mildly lobulated contour of liver compatible with liver parenchymal disease. 

  A 1.77 cm lesion in S7 liver with early enhancement and isoenhancement in venous 

  phases, suspect FNH.

  A 1.6 cm poor enhancement hypodewnse lesion in S8 liver.

  No definite biliary dilatation. 

  No definite space occupying lesion in the adrenal glands, spleen and pancreas. 

  Normal function and contour of bil. kidneys. 

  Patency of bil. ureters. 

  No definite enlargement of retroperitoneal LNs. 

  No abnormal fluid collection in the abdomen. 

  Enlarged prostate glands with internal small calcifcation. 

  S/P TURP.

    after injection.

    staging TxN0M0 (AJCC 8th).

中文報告:

    《報告內容》

        受檢者 陳李? 接受3.84毫居里(mCi)的鎵-68攝護腺特異膜抗原正子示蹤劑 (68Ga-PSM

    A-HBED-CC) 靜脈注射，隨後靜躺60分鐘等待藥物全身分佈，再接受正子斷層造影。正子斷層

    造影(PET)包括從大腿上半部到顱頂的範圍。

    

    《檢查結果》

    正子斷層造影顯示：攝護腺癌無合併淋巴結或遠端轉移。

          

    《檢查備註》

    (1) 鎵-68攝護腺特異膜抗原正子掃描雖然可以檢查出大部份的攝護腺癌病變，但由於藥物及

    儀器本身的特性及限制，對於一些小於0.5公分的癌組織及部份小細胞攝護腺癌並無法偵測出

    。建議您搭配其它癌症檢查〈如血液腫瘤指數、核磁共振、超音波檢查等〉，可達相輔相成

    的效果。

    

    (2) Certainty score說明：score 1 = 良性變化; score 2 = 病變性質不確定; score 3 =

     可能為惡性病變; score 4 = 高度懷疑是惡性病變。

    

    (3)有關標準化攝取值(SUV)說明：標準化攝取值是一項經電腦計算身體內各組織對放射性同

    位素(如鎵-68攝護腺特異膜抗原正子示蹤劑)攝取能力的參考數值。

     T11 and L4-L5 spines, right ilium, left clavicle (score 3); bilateral lateral 

    ribs, and right shoulder and knee joints (score 1).

         There was no other focal area of abnormal uptake of radioactivity involving

     the whole skeletal system.





Impression:

    1. Active thoracolumbar spines, right ilium, and left clavicle lesions, 

    malignancy bony metastases should be watched.

    2. Bilateral rib lesions, post-traumatic effects was more likely.

    3. Right shoulder and right knee joint lesions, probably arthritis.





Suggestion:

    Nil





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Score 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

Report:

    ** PROCEDURE

    The bone scan was requested for oncology survey. The bone scan was performed 3 

    hr after given 20.83 mCi Tc-99m MDP(i.v.). Previous scan on 2018/11/09 was 

    available for comparison.  

    ** SCAN FINDINGS

    - multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the L4-L5 

    spines, right ilium, left clavicle, left S-I joint (score 3); right posterior 4

    th rib (score 2); bilateral lateral ribs, and right shoulder and knee joints (

    score 1).

    

    - As compared with previous study the scan showed new equivocal lesion at right 

    posterior rib, less evident lesion at T11 spine, other lesions seemed stationary

    .





Impression:

    1. Spine, right ilium, and left clavicle lesions, maligiancy bony metastases 

    shoule be watched out.

    2. Right posterior rib, either malignancy with bony metastasis or post traumatic

     effect may show this picture.

    3. Biilateral rib lesions, probably post-traumatic effects.

    4. Right shoulder and right knee joint lesions, probably arthritis.

    





Suggestion:

    Please correlation with clinical and other imaging findings.





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign; Score 2 = equivocal; Score 3 = possible 

    malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy

A 60 Y/O male;

  Clinical Information:

  Right L4-5 radiculopathy --> Arrange L-S spine MRI for further evaluation.

  

  

  MRI of the L- spine without Gd-DTPA IV administration, in sagittal and axial 

  projections using T1W, T2W, w/wo GRE sequences, shows :

  

  1. Retrolisthesis of L2 on L3, L3 on L4, L4 on L5, L5 on S1 mildly.

  2. Scoliosis of the L-spine.

  3. Wedging deformity of L1 and L2.

  4. Posterior osteophytes at L2-3, L3-4, L4-5 and L5-S1 levels, effacing the thecal 

  sac.

  5. Hypertrophic facets and thickened ligamentum flavum contributing to spinal 

  canal and neuroforaminal stenosis at L1-2, L2-3, L3-4, L4-5 and L5-S1 levels.

  6. Bulging discs at L1-2, L2-3, L3-4, and L5-S1 levels effacing the thecal sac.

  7. Broad-based left posterolateral HIVD at L4-5 level.

  8. Increased fat in the spinal canal also contributing to spinal canal stenosis, 

  probably lipomatosis.

  9. Heterogeneous nodule over the right spinal canal and neuroforamen at L3/4 level,

   with T1-isointensity and T2-mixed hyperintensity and hypointensity, DDX: hematoma,

   neoplasm.

  

  Summary: 

  1. Heterogeneous nodule over the right spinal canal and neuroforamen at L3/4 level,

   DDX: hematoma, neoplasm.

  2. Broad-based left posterolateral HIVD at L4-5 level.

  3. Lumbar spondylosis causing spinal canal stenosis and neuroforaminal 

  encroachment as aforementioned.

  4. Retrolisthesis of L2 on L3, L3 onL4, L4 on L5, L5 on S1 mildly.

    microCi of C-14-labeled urea.The counting result of the breath sample was 1950 

    DPM.

    

    碳14尿素呼吸測試:

    in the stomach.

Suggesstion:

    Please follow at GI clinic.

                 無法決定是否感染幽門桿菌         

    >=200 DPM    Positive study for Helicobacter pylori infection

                 幽門桿菌陽性反應

    The bone scan was performed 3 hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP (i.v.) and 

    revealed multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the

     T6, T12, L1 spine (score 3); cervical spine, lumbosacral junction (score 2), 

    bilateral knee, ankle, shoulder, elbow and wrist joints and left 3rd rib at 

    anterior portion (score 1).

         Diffuse increased soft tissue uptake at bilateral upper lung fields.

         There was no other focal area of abnormal uptake of radioactivity involving

     the whole skeletal system.





Impression:

    1. Thoracolumbar spine lesions, bone metastases should be considered first 

    unless proved otherwise.

    2. Cervical spine and lumbosacral junction lesions, either degenerative spine 

    disease or bone metastasis may show this picture.

    3. Multiple joints lesions, probably arthritis.

    4. Left 3rd rib lesion, probably post-traumatic effect.

    5. Diffuse increased uptake at bilateral upper lung fields, probably metastatic 

    calcification.

    Please correlation with clinical and other imaging findings.

Prostate cancer of bil. lobes with bone metastasis

  6. No obvious obstructive lesion of the bowel.

  7. No ascites or pneumoperitoneum. Calcifications at right hemidiaphragm.

  8. No enlarged lymph node in the retroperitoneum, mesentery, or pelvis.

  9. Prostate enlargement with calcifications.

  10. No definite lung nodule in the visible lower lungs. No pleural effusion.

  11. Degenerative change of thoracolumbar spine with marginal osteophytes.

  12. Retrolisthesis of L1-3 grade I.

  13. Anterior wedging of T12 r/o mild compression fracture.

  Suggestive of cholangitis with a small liver abscess in S3 of liver. HCC is not 

  likely. Suggest follow up imaging.

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 3 hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP (i.v.) and 

    revealed multiple focal areas of increased uptake of radioactivity involving the

     L1-L2 and L4-L5 spines, bilateral shoulder and knee joints (score 1).

         There was no other focal area of abnormal uptake of radioactivity involving

     the whole skeletal system.





Impression:

    1. No definite evidence of malignancy bony metastasis.

    2. Lumbar spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    3. Multiple joint lesions, probably osteoarthritis.





Suggestion:

    Nil





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion ; Score 2 = equivocal lesion ; Score 3

     = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of malignancy





            判讀醫師　　：蔡席晨

Report:

    The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study was performed with dipyridamole 

    pharmacologic stress. Intravenous dipyridamole was administered at a rate of 0.1

    42 mg/kg/min for 4 min. The administered dose was 8.4 ml (5mg/ml).

         No significant discomfort was noted during dipyridamole stress.

         The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study performed 5 mins after 

    intravenous injection of 2-3mCi of Tl-201 and 4 hours later revealed homogeneous

     distribution of radioactivity in myocardium of LV in each study.

A 69-year-old male is a case of right lower gum cancer S/P resection.



TECHNIQUE: CT of Head & Neck, Chest and Abdomen with and without IV contrast

 enhancement



COMPARISON: MRI on 2018-11-01



FINDINGS:



1. Primary site:

  - Right retromolar and lower gum cancer S/P wide excision, inferior 

maxillectomy, segmental mandibullectomy and myocutaneous flap reconstruction.

  - No obvious abnormal enhancing mass at the surgical site.

2. Other head and neck region:

  - No obvious focal soft tissue mass can be noted in elsewhere in the head and 

neck region. 

3. Nodal status:

  - S/P right neck dissection.

  - No evidence of metastatic lymphadenopathy in the head and neck region. A few

 slightly enlarged nodes in bil. neck, reactive hyperplasia is considered.

4. Bone status:

  - No obvious bony destruction.

  - Hypertrophic facet joints at left C3-4-5-6-7.

5. Visible brain, skull base and orbit:

  - Atherosclerosis in bil. carotid siphons and vertebrobasilar system.

6. Sinonasal cavity and mastoid:

  - Opacification of bilateral mastoid air cells, chronic mastoiditis is 

considered.

7. Salivary glands and thyroid glands: 

  - S/P right submandibullectomy.

8. Screening chest and abdomen:

  - Focal dilatation of the distal abdominal aorta (3.5 cm), suggesting aortic 

aneurysm.

  - A tiny arterial outpouching at the aortic arch. R/O focal dissection.

  - Calcification of coronary arteries and aortoilliac arteries.

  - A necrotic rim-enhancing nodule (2.1 cm) at the RLL attaching to the chest 

wall. Suspicious lung cancer recurrence.

  - Presence of a heterogenous enhancing mass (4.2 cm) at the RLL encasing the 

bronchus, suspicious tumor recurrence.

  - Enlarged right hilar node (1.3 cm).

  - Ground glass opacities in RUL. 

  - Diffuse tree-in-bud pattern in the RLL, suggestive of endobronchial spread (

neoplasm or infectious process).

  - No definite metastatic lesion in the chest and abdomen on screening. Suggest

 clinical correlation or follow up.



IMPRESSION: 

1. Right retomolar and right lower gum cancer S/P resection. No definite 

evidence of locoregional recurrence on this CT.

2. Two RLL mass (2.1 cm and 4.2 cm) and enlarged right hilar lymph node (1.3 cm)

 as abovementioned. Suspicious for lung cancer recurrence.

3. Diffuse tree-in-bud pattern in the RLL, suggestive of endobronchial spread (

neoplasm or infectious process).

4. Ground glass opacities in RUL. R/O infection/inflammation.

5. R/O aortic aneurysm at distal abdominal aorta and focal dissection at aortic 

arch.

report.finding:
Computed Tomography of Abdomen With and Without Enhancement Show:

  

  Methods:

  Axial 5 mm sections from the lower chest to the pelvis were obtained before and 

  after intravenous contrast medium administration, coronal reconstruction 

  supplemented.

  

  Findings: 

  Imaged portions of the lung and soft tissues are normal.

  The liver is normally positioned and has normal size and undulating borders.

  Its internal structure and attenuation values are normal. The intrahepatic and 

  extrahepatic bile ducts and gallbladder are unremarkable.

  The spleen is orthotopic and of normal size. It has smooth outer contours and a 

  homogeneous internal structure.

  The pancreas is normal in size, position, and internal structure with smooth, 

  lobulated outer contours. The pancreatic duct is unobstructed.

  Both kidneys show normal size and position. The left renal parenchyma shows 2.6 cm 

  cystic nodule.

  The renal pelvis and calices show a normal configuration. The urinary drainage 

  tract is unobstructed.

  The adrenal glands are unremarkable.

  The pelvic inlet appears normal, with normal configuration of the iliac wings and 

  iliopsoas muscles.

  The mesentery shows whorl-like appearance. Imaged bowel structures, especially the 

  cecum and rectum, show no abnormalities with no evidence of wall thickening or 

  mass lesions. The perirectal fat and ischiorectal fossa are unremarkable. The 

  adequately distended urinary bladder has smooth outer contours and normal wall 

  thickness. The seminal vesicles are of normal size. The angle between the bladder 

  and seminal vesicle is clear and normal on each side.

  The prostate shows enlarged size and calcified spots.

  The aorta shows calcified walls and mural thrombi. There are no signs of 

  lymphadenopathy.

  The appearance of the pelvic skeleton, especially the femoral heads and sacroiliac 

  joints, is normal. Degenerative change of lumbar spine with spurs formation.

  There are no soft-tissue abnormalities.

  

  Impression: 

  Whorl-like appearance of mesentery R/O mesenteric torsion.

Computed Tomography of Brain Without Enhancement Show:

  

  There are no obvious abnormalities in the scalp

  No evidence of bony fracture

  No mid-line structure deviation

  Dilated ventricular system probably due to brain degeneration

  Diffusely prominent cerebral fissures, cisterns & sulci

  No abnormal parenchymal attenuation change

  No evidence of intracranial hemorrhage

  No evidence of intracranial tumor

  Artifact in skull base

  There are no abnormalities in the cerebellopontine angle area on both sides

  Normal pituitary fossa & juxtasellar cisterns

  Clear of bil. paranasal sinuses and bil. mastoid air cells

  Unremarkable finding of orbital content.

  Unremarkable finding of visible nasopharynx.

  Calcification of bilateral internal carotid siphons. 

  

  IMP: 

  1. No evidence of intracranial hemorrhage

  2. Brain degeneration with calcification of bilateral internal carotid siphons.

Computed Tomography of Brain Without Enhancement Show:



Method:

Axial noncontrast 5 mm sections from the skull base to the vertex were obtained,

 followed by reconstructed coronal sections developed.



Findings:

The interhemispheric fissure is centered on the midline. The cerebrum and 

cerebellum show diffusely prominent cerebral fissures, cisterns & sulci.

The cerebral ventricles are of normal size and symmetrically arranged. But the 

temporal horns are dilated.

There are no signs of increased intracranial pressure.

Normal development of the white matter and cortex, with multiple low attenuation

 lesions over bilateral periventricular and subcortical white matter regions.

The basal ganglia, internal capsule, corpus callosum, and thalamus appear normal

.

The brain stem and cerebellum also appear normal.

The sella and pituitary are normal. Parasellar structures are unremarkable.

There are no abnormalities in the cerebellopontine angle area on both sides.

The right maxillary sinus is partially opacified. The nasal septum shows 

paradoxical deviation. The number of both sides of pneumatic mastoid air cells 

is decreased. The orbital contents are unremarkable. There are no abnormalities 

in the calvarium.



Impression: 

Cerebral small vessel disease.

            判讀醫師　　：黃淳邦

A 77 Y/O male;

  Clinical Information:

  Prostate cancer, GS: 3+3 , PSA: 9.

  

  Imaging Protocol: 

  Abdomen and pelvis MRI using axial T1WI, T2WI, sagittal T2WI, coronal T2WI 

  and fat.-sat images of axial & sagittal scans without and with Gd-DTPA enhancement 

  were performed as ordered by clinicians for a patient of clinical history of 

  prostate cancer. 

  

  It showed: 

  

  Tumor location / Size/ Invasion (only for MRI):

  1. The prostate cancers are visible. 

  2. The visible tumors involve both lobes. Of all visible tumors, the tumor size of 

  the biggest one is  2.4 cm.

  3. The visible prostate tumors have no extra-prostate invasion, including no 

  extra-capsular extension, no seminal vesicle invasion, no pelvic sidewall invasion,

   no pelvic organ(s) (rectum, bladder) invasion.

  

  Regional nodal metastasis:

  There is no regional nodal metastasis at obturator (right, left, bilateral), 

  internal iliac (right, left, bilateral), external iliac (right, left, bilateral), 

  and sacral areas.

    

  Distant metastasis (In this study):

  There is no distant metastasis at non-regional lymph nodes including common iliac, 

  inguinal, or para-aortic areas, and bone shown in this imaging study.

  

  Other findings:

  focal hyperintense nodule at lower T-spine. Suspicious of hemangioma.

  

  IMP: prostate cancer, MRI stage: T2c N0 Mx

Report:

    The bone scan was performed 2hrs after given 20 mCi of Tc-99m MDP

    (i.v.).

    The whole body bone scan revealed multiple focal areas of

    increased uptake of radioactivity involving the L3-L5 spines(score 1),

    and bilateral knee joints(score 1).

    There was a relatively cold area in the left knee joint,

    compatible with post total knee replacement.

    There was no other focal area of abnormal uptake of radioactivity

    in the whole body skeletal system.

    





Impression:

    1. No definite evidence of malignancy bony metastasis.

    2. L-spine lesions, probably degenerative spine disease.

    3. Right knee joint lesion, probably arthritis.

    4. Left knee joint lesion, probably post-operation response.

    





Suggesstion:

    Nil

    





Comment:

    Score 0 = normal; Score 1 = benign lesion; Score 2 = equivocal lesion;

    Score 3 = possible malignancy; Score 4 = high probability of

    malignancy.

Report:

    The myocardial perfusion SPECT study was performed with dipyridamole 

    pharmacologic stress. Intravenous dipyridamole was administered at a rate of 0.1

    42 mg/kg/min for 4 min. The administered dose was 35.5 mg.

    No significant discomfort was noted during dipyridamole stress.

    The Tl-201 myocardial perfusion SPECT study performed 5 mins after intravenous 2

    mCi Tl-201 and 4 hours later revealed homogeneous distribution of radioactivity 

    in myocardium of LV in each study.





Impression:

    No evidence of myocardial infarction or ischemia.





Suggestion:

    Nil





Comment:

    The LVEF by Tl-201 EKG-gated perfusion scan was calculated as: Stress LVEF: 66%,

     Rest LVEF: 58%.





中文報告:

    無明顯證據顯示左心室心肌缺血或壞死
